description: Harrisburg: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission has issued the following document:. Eckert, Seamans, Cherin,& Mellott, LLC. Re: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission.
sourceClass: Government Agencies (U.S.), Government Policy, Local Government, National Government

subjectCode.description: Trading Impact (ICE Codes) Important Corporate Events

text:
Harrisburg: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission has issued the following
document:

Via Electronic Mail Only

Daniel Clearfield, Esquire

Deanne O'Dell, Esquire

Karen O. Moury, Esquire

Eckert, Seamans, Cherin, & Mellott, LLC

213 Market Street

8th Floor

Harrisburg, PA 17101

Re: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission

v.

Pittsburgh Water and Sewer Authority

Docket Nos. R-2020-3017951 (Water)

C-2020-3019348

R-2020-3017970 (Wastewater)

C-2020-3019349

Petition of Pittsburgh Water and Sewer

Authority For Waiver of Provisions of Act 11 to

Increase the DSIC CAP, to Permit Levelization

of DSIC Charges, and to Authorize the Pay-As-

You-Go Method of Financing

Docket No. P-2020-3019019

Dear Counsel:

Enclosed you will find two copies of the Interrogatories of the Office of
Consumer Advocate, Set

XXI, in the above-referenced proceedings.

In accordance with the Commission's Rules of Practice and Procedure, as
modified during the April

22, 2020 Prehearing Conference, we request that PWSA provide verified answers
to these inquiries within

ten (10) days of service on a best-efforts basis, but no later than within
fifteen (15) days of service. Also,

please forward the verified answers as they are completed, rather than waiting
until the responses to the full

set are completed. We would appreciate it if you would communicate any
objections you may have to these

interrogatories as soon as possible.

Daniel Clearfield, Esquire

Deanne O'Dell, Esquire

Karen O. Moury, Esquire

June 4, 2020

Page 2

We also request that you send a copy of the answers directly to our
consultant, as listed

below:

Scott J. Rubin

333 Oak Lane

Bloomsburg, PA 17815

E-Mail: [OCAPWSA2020@paoca.org](mailto:OCAPWSA2020@paoca.org)

If you have any questions, please call us. By copy of this letter, copies of
these

interrogatories have been served upon all parties. A certificate of service
showing service of

these interrogatories on all parties has been filed with Secretary Chiavetta
of the Pennsylvania

Public Utility Commission as required by 52 Pa. Code SS 5.341(b).

Very truly yours,

/s/ Christine Maloni Hoover

Christine Maloni Hoover

Senior Assistant Consumer Advocate

PA Attorney I.D. # 50026

E-Mail: [CHoover@paoca.org](mailto:CHoover@paoca.org)

Enclosures:

cc: PUC Secretary Rosemary Chiavetta, (Letter and Certificate of Service only)

title: Regulatory update: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission; PITTSBURGH WATER AND SEWER AUTHORITY , has issued ( R-2020-3017951) Cert of Srvc to Intrrg Set XXI - OCA.
html:
Harrisburg: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission has issued the following document:

Via Electronic Mail Only

Daniel Clearfield, Esquire

Deanne O'Dell, Esquire

Karen O. Moury, Esquire

Eckert, Seamans, Cherin, & Mellott, LLC

213 Market Street

8th Floor

Harrisburg, PA 17101

Re: Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission

v.

Pittsburgh Water and Sewer Authority

Docket Nos. R-2020-3017951 (Water)

C-2020-3019348

R-2020-3017970 (Wastewater)

C-2020-3019349

Petition of Pittsburgh Water and Sewer

Authority For Waiver of Provisions of Act 11 to

Increase the DSIC CAP, to Permit Levelization

of DSIC Charges, and to Authorize the Pay-As-

You-Go Method of Financing

Docket No. P-2020-3019019

Dear Counsel:

Enclosed you will find two copies of the Interrogatories of the Office of Consumer Advocate, Set

XXI, in the above-referenced proceedings.

In accordance with the Commission's Rules of Practice and Procedure, as modified during the April

22, 2020 Prehearing Conference, we request that PWSA provide verified answers to these inquiries within

ten (10) days of service on a best-efforts basis, but no later than within fifteen (15) days of service. Also,

please forward the verified answers as they are completed, rather than waiting until the responses to the full

set are completed. We would appreciate it if you would communicate any objections you may have to these

interrogatories as soon as possible.

Daniel Clearfield, Esquire

Deanne O'Dell, Esquire

Karen O. Moury, Esquire

June 4, 2020

Page 2

We also request that you send a copy of the answers directly to our consultant, as listed

below:

Scott J. Rubin

333 Oak Lane

Bloomsburg, PA 17815

E-Mail: OCAPWSA2020@paoca.org

If you have any questions, please call us. By copy of this letter, copies of these

interrogatories have been served upon all parties. A certificate of service showing service of

these interrogatories on all parties has been filed with Secretary Chiavetta of the Pennsylvania

Public Utility Commission as required by 52 Pa. Code SS 5.341(b).

Very truly yours,

/s/ Christine Maloni Hoover

Christine Maloni Hoover

Senior Assistant Consumer Advocate

PA Attorney I.D. # 50026

E-Mail: CHoover@paoca.org

Enclosures:

cc: PUC Secretary Rosemary Chiavetta, (Letter and Certificate of Service only)
